newsitem.title: CHINA: Wind and rain wreck Hong Kong ice spectacle.
newsitem.headline: Wind and rain wreck Hong Kong ice spectacle.

text.p: Tens of thousands of Batman and Bugs Bunny fans will have to claim their money back after wet and windy weather in Hong Kong wrecked the big top and a multi-million dollar ice spectacle.

Organisers of the US$2 million Hong Kong ice show, the Australasian Entertainment Company (AEC), cancelled the spectacle after rain and wind tore down part of the 4,000 seat tent and made it impossible to prepare the temporary ice rink.
Some 32,000 tickets have to be refunded.
Friday night's disaster was the climax of a calamitous week. On Thursday 4,000 frustrated spectators were sent home after rain swamped the rink just before showtime.
"We are terribly, terribly sorry," said organiser Dale Rennie. "Had the weather decided not to be our nemesis, we would have been okay," he told the South China Morning Post.
"It has been a very expensive scenario for us."
More than 50 skaters and crew from around the world were packing their bags and heading back to the United States.
Young fans of Batman and Robin, Sylvester the Cat, Tweetie Pie and Bugs Bunny, all to have been featured in the show, were saddened by the washout.
"Where is Batman and Mr Freezer," asked one upset three-year-old.
Hong Kong has suffered weeks of heavy rain and last Saturday was hit head-on by a typhoon.
